data.title: Crashes Every every minute
data.body: I was working on it around 4 months and now it crashes every minute while writing code.

data.title: test
Copy Paste not working when editing XML files
data.body:
### Description

When copy pasting from an xml file, it pastes only the first letter of the copy operation.
For example, if you select copy text "Hello World" then it will paste only "H".
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open the attached example xml file (See ZIP download).
2. Copy a piece of text.
3. Paste back into xml file or notepad window.
   [Example - Copy.zip](https://github.com/atom/atom/files/295162/Example.-.Copy.zip)

**Expected behavior:** 

The full text should be copied.

**Actual behavior:**

Only the first letter is copied.
### Versions

Atom 1.7.4

data.title: Very slow indexing when using Cryptomator encrypted folder (Windows 10)
data.body:
### Description

https://cryptomator.org/ is a client side encryption software. When atom opens a mounted cryptomator vault (which is mapped to a network drive locally) it tries to index the hidden folders (named "." and ".."). This indexing never stops since atom is trying to index the hidden folders that contain the cryptomator metadata. This occurs on Windows 10 Pro. The issue is not present on OSX.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Clone any repo (e.g. https://github.com/twitter/heron)
2. Install cryptomator (https://cryptomator.org/downloads/#winDownload). Java client does not require installation.
3. Create a new vault in cryptomator for the heron repo
4. Mount the vault
5. Open the network drive (usually Z: drive) in atom
6. Try to find a file (Ctrl-P). Atom says "indexing" forever. Ctrl-P is broken and you can't find any files in the project.

I've also tried adding "." and ".." to the ignored folders list in settings (and enabled "hide hidden folders" in tree-view plugin). This doesn't make a difference and these folders are not hidden.

**Expected behavior:**
Atom should quickly index the repo. It takes ~2 seconds to index the non-encrypted heron repo. 

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
Atom tries to index these hidden folders. Indexing goes on forever because it's trying to index a deep structure of hidden folders.
### Versions

1.7.4 (windows 10 pro x64 machine)

data.title: 1.8.4 fails to install on Windows 10, while 1.7.4 install just fine
data.body:
Hi there!

When attempting to install 1.8.4 beta on a Windows 10 machine, I get the following error:

SquirrelSetup.log

```
2016-06-01 19:30:21> Program: Starting Squirrel Updater: --install .
2016-06-01 19:30:21> Program: Starting install, writing to C:\Users\Rafael Renan Pacheco\AppData\Local\SquirrelTemp
2016-06-01 19:30:21> Program: About to install to: C:\Users\Rafael Renan Pacheco\AppData\Local\atom
2016-06-01 19:30:23> CheckForUpdateImpl: Failed to load local releases, starting from scratch: System.IO.DirectoryNotFoundException: Não foi possível localizar uma parte do caminho 'C:\Users\Rafael Renan Pacheco\AppData\Local\atom\packages\RELEASES'.
   em System.IO.__Error.WinIOError(Int32 errorCode, String maybeFullPath)
   em System.IO.FileStream.Init(String path, FileMode mode, FileAccess access, Int32 rights, Boolean useRights, FileShare share, Int32 bufferSize, FileOptions options, SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES secAttrs, String msgPath, Boolean bFromProxy, Boolean useLongPath, Boolean checkHost)
   em System.IO.FileStream..ctor(String path, FileMode mode, FileAccess access, FileShare share)
   em Squirrel.Utility.LoadLocalReleases(String localReleaseFile)
   em Squirrel.UpdateManager.CheckForUpdateImpl.<CheckForUpdate>d__3f.MoveNext()
```

Looks like it was caused by the user dir having spaces in it, but this is a normal behavior in Windows 10 machines, and should not fail to install. Other apps install stuffs in user dir just fine. Even Atom 1.7.4 stable installed just fine here.

I also attempted to install after disabling my antivirus, but I got the exactly same error log.

Since 1.7.4 installer works, I guess this could be fixed in 1.8 beta branch as well...

Thanks!

data.title: Studying the evolution of Atom's project
data.body:
Hi there, 

I'm a researcher studying software evolution. I'm a researcher studying software evolution. As part of my current research, I'm studying the implications of open-sourcing a proprietary software, for instance, if the project succeed in attracting newcomers Atom was in my list. 

To further analyze the impacts of Atom’s migration, we analyzed the git log commit history of your project in terms of _number of contributions_, _number of newcomers_, and _number of contributors per month_. The following figure presents a temporal perspective regarding these three measures. 

![atom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/235062/15728231/1bf2b7b0-2810-11e6-9636-319e9fd20c87.png)

Given the numbers presented in the graphic, we would like to ask Atom developers the following questions:
1. What motivated the project to open its source code at Github? How do you evaluate the benefits of this migration?
2. Does this snapshot make sense? Did you find any inconsistency on the data?
3. Do you have any internal policy to promote/attract/retain newcomers? If so, do them succeed?
4. Why the number of contribution did not increase while the number of contributors increased?
5. Did you expect an increasing number of newcomers joining the project right after it became open-source?

Thanks in advance for your collaboration,

Gustavo Pinto, PhD
http://www.gustavopinto.org

data.title: apm update -> Request for package information failed: connect ETIMEDOUT
data.body:
### Description

Timeouts fetching updates from apm and through the atom interface
`Request for package information failed: connect TIME-OUT`

These timeouts seem to be isolated somehow to Telstra Bigpond AFAIK -> https://discuss.atom.io/t/anyone-experiencing-apm-update-timeout/28258/5

Timeout issue disappears when using a full tunnel VPN, which presumably masks the original IP on the Telstra Bigpond ISP. In my case this is to a US based VPN endpoint giving me a 17/8 address.

The issue is also resolved by connecting to non Bigpond based internet service, I have had success using my Telstra 4G phone.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Connect to home Telstra Bigpond cable service
2. Run apm update

data.title: Merge Bootstrap + Core styles
data.body:
⚠️  This is in parallel to #11839 + #11858. Don't merge all PRs, only pick one. ⚠️ 

This PR does:
1. Remove `bootstrap` dependency
2. Merge Bootstrap `3.3.6` + some Core styles and publish it as [atom-ui](https://www.npmjs.com/package/atom-ui) module
3. Add `atom-ui` dependency

Refs: #6351, #8237 
#### Stays in core `atom/atom/static`:
- [x] Octicons
- [x] Normalize
- [x] Scaffolding
- [x] Cursors
- [x] Panels
- [x] Panes
- [x] Syntax
- [x] `text-editor-light`
- [x] `workspace-view`
#### Moved + merged into the [atom/atom-ui](https://github.com/atom/atom-ui) package:
- [x] Tooltips
- [x] Buttons + Button Groups
- [x] Lists
- [x] Close
- [x] Code
- [x] Nav
- [x] Scaffolding
- [x] Utilities
- [x] Alerts
- [x] Tables
- [x] Forms
- [x] Type
- [x] Normalize
- [x] Clean up some un-used styles. Like IE hacks etc.
#### Removed:
- 🔥  grid
- 🔥  input-groups
- 🔥  labels
- 🔥  thumbnails
## Motivation

Currently we load Bootstrap and then try to override it in core. Merging them allows more control and adjustments can be made directly. Also, moving out of core and into a separate package feels less intimidating and can easier be rolled back in `package.json`.
## Concerns

Some styles got removed, so there is a chance that something might look unstyled or off. Packages bundled with Atom should be fine, but it's hard to predict if community packages rely on any of the removed styles. Maybe in the Beta phase we can catch some regressions.

Affected packages:
- [x] `autocomplete-plus` fixed by [reverting](https://github.com/atom/atom-ui/pull/4) some refactoring.
- [x] [godoc](https://github.com/zmb3/godoc/pull/17) uses `.close`. Fixed by [adding](https://github.com/atom/atom-ui/pull/5) `.close` too.

data.title: The default keybindings in core, prevent the use of extended ascii characters.
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ X ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?

You can reproduce the issue all day long. I didn't try it in safe mode, because it's irrelevant. If safe mode uses the default keybindings, then it will be broken there too.  
- [ X ] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?

I am using the latest version. Version 1.7.3
- [ X ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

Yes
### Description

In an Atom document I should be able to enter extended ascii characters by holding down the alt key and typing the character's value. For instance ...

[alt] 0169 = ©
[alt] 0128 = €
[alt] 0140 = Œ
[alt] 0174 = ®
[alt] 0216 = Ø

etc... However, the default keymappings use [alt] <number> to switch between tabs, so when you have multiple documents open in multiple tabs, typing [alt] 0169 results in the editor switching to the first tab, then the sixth tab, then the ninth one (or the last one if you don't have nine open), then when you release the [alt] key, the desired character is inserted in the wrong document.  
### Steps to Reproduce
1. open the Atom editor with multiple documents in multiple tabs.
2. Choose a document to insert a Ø into.
3. hold the [alt] key down and type 0216 then release the [alt] key.

The tab selection will bounce around as you type the digits, then the character will most likely be inserted into the wrong document.  

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

I expect Atom to stay on the document I am Editing. Atom should respect default Windows keystrokes, and not implement breaking behavior.    

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

The tab selection bounces around as you type the digits, then the character will inserted into the wrong document.  
### Versions

Atom    : 1.7.4
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python
git 2.8.1.windows.1
visual studio

data.title: "The editor has crashed" after editing remote files with FileZilla
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

When exiting Atom after editing and uploading a file through FileZilla the editor fails to exit cleanly.

This occurs regardless of whether or not all files have been closed out in Atom before exiting, but only if they've been deleted by FileZilla through the "Finish editing and delete local file." option. Upon opening atom the next time there may sometimes be a tab left over for the file you were last editing. After this occurs once the editor can sometimes crash on subsequent exits and start ups.

I'm wondering if this has anything to do with filelocks and whether or not this issue is with the treeview (as opposed to atom core).
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open a remote file with FileZilla while ensuring Atom selected as the default editor
2. Save the file in Atom
3. When FileZilla prompts you to do so, select "Finish editing and delete local file."
4. Exit Atom

**Expected behavior:** The editor should exit successfully.

**Actual behavior:** The editor fails to exit cleanly.
### Versions

1.8.0-beta4 on Windows 10

OS: Windows 8, 10
Atom: v1.7.4

@mojombo @Caged @schacon @defunkt @benburkert 
### Description

Project folders disappear

Right from when I've been using v1.0, this has been persistent. When Atom is closed and I open a file with Atom from Windows File Explorer, it opens the file in Atom and replaces my Project Folders, making the file name a Project in the Tree View and then I have to add all my Project Folders again.

I've always wanted to report this issue but I thought it would be fixed sooner.

Some help would be appreciated. Thanks.

**Expected behavior:** Atom keeps my project folders

**Actual behavior:** Project folders disappear and filename becomes a folder

data.title: Exclude temporary download of updates from Time Machine on OS X
data.body:
On OS X, Atom temporarily stores downloaded updates at `~/Library/Application Support/com.github.atom.ShipIt/`.

These files are included in Time Machine backups, causing a huge amount of backup churn (often several hundreds of megabytes in each hourly backup).

There are two possible solutions:
- Set the temporary download to be excluded from Time Machine backups. This can be done from the commandline using `tmutil addexclusion <path>`.
- A more 'correct' solution would be to store the temporary download in a subdirectory of `~/Library/Caches/`. This whole directory is automatically excluded from Time Machine backups.

Atom v 1.7.4.

(I am assuming this is an Atom bug rather than one in a third-party library. I haven't been able to find anything called 'shipit' so I assume it is part of Atom.)

data.title: Fix flexbox issues after upgrading to Electron v0.37.8
data.body:
1) Fixes atom/find-and-replace#732.
2) Fixes an issue with resizing atom panes when one or more panes had many open tabs.

After [upgrading to Electron v0.37.8](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/11474), we have noticed a couple of regressions when resizing some of Atom's UI elements. In particular, it seems like some of the flexbox rules for laying content out have changed since v0.36.12, and this causes elements like `atom-pane` or find-and-replace input boxes, to not shrink correctly when they are resized.

This pull-request fixes 1) by removing the explicit width on `atom-text-editor`'s `.lines` element (setting it should be unnecessary after #6733), which sometimes caused `atom-text-editor`'s width to determine the width of its parent, and 2) by allowing `atom-pane`s to be shrunk indefinitely, as it was before the Electron bump.

data.title: Windows: Press+Release Alt or F10 key does not go to the application menu; Shift-F10 does go to the system menu
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [X] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [X] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?  
- [X] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [X] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [X] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [X] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

On Windows: 
1. Press+Release Alt key does not go to the application menu the visual feedback is a quick blink of the underscore characters that should be bound to Alt-letter key combinations (those do not work either, but that's a different issue); https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Menu_bar#Microsoft_Windows
2. Press+Release F10 key does not go to the application menu it doesn't give any visual feedback either; https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Menu_bar#Microsoft_Windows
3. Press+Release Shift-F10 keys does go to the context menu https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Context_menu
4. Press+Release Alt+Space keys does go to the system menu https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Common_menus_in_Microsoft_Windows#System_menu

Notes:
- I'm on Windows 7 x64 Pro (all updates applied) using Atom 1.7.4 default install in `C:\Users\jeroenp\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.7.4\`
- Language/Keyboard in `Region and Language` is `Dutch (Netherlands) - United States-International`, but it also reproduces with  `Dutch (Netherlands) - US`
- I've searched using https://github.com/atom/atom/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+alt+key+windows
- I'm pretty convinced this is not a duplicate of #10732 or #4057 or #35 (it fails with either Left or Right Alt keys and also reproduces for `US` keyboard)
- It reproduces both through Remote Desktop and when physically logged on to the machine.
- Other Windows Applications I tried do not fail this.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Start Atom (safe mode or regular does not matter)
2. Press+Release the Alt-Key

**Expected behaviour:** The menu to get focus.

**Actual behaviour:** the visual feedback is a quick blink of the underscore characters that should be bound to Alt-letter key combinations (those do not work either, but that's a different issue)
1. Start Atom (safe mode or regular does not matter)
2. Press+Release the F10 key

**Expected behaviour:** The menu to get focus.

**Actual behaviour:** No visual feedback at all.
1. Start Atom (safe mode or regular does not matter)
2. Press+Release the Shift-F10 keys

**Expected behaviour:** The context menu to get focus.

**Actual behaviour:** No visual feedback at all.
1. Start Atom (safe mode or regular does not matter)
2. Press+Release Alt+Space keys

**Expected behaviour:** The system menu to get focus.

**Actual behaviour:** No visual feedback at all.
### Versions

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.
#### Atom

```
C:\Users\jeroenp\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.7.4>
Atom    : 1.7.4
Electron: 0.36.8
```

data.title: Fix overlay scrolling
data.body:
Right now editor scrolling is not sensitive to overlays that are present, so that a line annotation at the end of a long line – or at the end of a document, if scrollPastEnd is not enabled – may be occluded by the edge of the window. This patch simply takes into account the overlay size when setting the scroll bounds so that these overlays will always be visible.

What's the best way to test things like scrolling and positioning of overlays? I can't seem to find current tests and it seems like being headless causes difficulties for testing things like positioning.

data.title: Checkboxes are clickable inside packages descriptions
data.body:
### Description

If the README of any package contains a checklist, when you visit the package description from within Atom, you are able to check/uncheck the items.

It's not an important bug, it just feels weird, probably the checkboxes should be set to `disabled`.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open the Atom settings
2. Click on "Install"
3. Search the "Atom Tabs Exposé" package and open its description
4. Scroll down till you find the checkboxes
5. Click on any of the checkboxes

**Expected behavior:** The checkboxes should not change state
**Actual behavior:** The checkboxes get checked/unchecked on click

![checkboxes](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5382443/15632864/fd2b206a-259e-11e6-9284-b0c7752e32a5.gif)
### Versions

``` Shell
~$ atom --version
Atom    : 1.7.4
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
~$ apm --version
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.9
git 2.6.4
```

OS X Yosemite 10.11.5 (15F34)

data.title: Visual glitch after clicking on "update all"
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)? **NB: will edit when next update is available**
- [ ] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)? **NB: no, but the changelog did not reference anything relevant, will update, as aforementioned**
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [ ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)? **NB: not sure, it affects multiple fields in the reference image**
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Visual glitch when clicking on "update all" in the "update packages window.
![screen shot 2016-05-29 at 11 15 27](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6138133/15632361/3d12adde-258f-11e6-9b40-3210b9813cb8.png)

NB: probably relevant: #732
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Have several tabs open
2. Open up settings
3. While this loads, click on the "updates available" in the bottom right
4. Click on "update all"
5. et voilá
6. NB: click on other tab resolves visual glitch

**Expected behavior:** No visual glitches

**Actual behavior:** Visual glitch
### Versions

```
Electron: 0.36.8

```


data.title: Atom crashes on windows 7 after dragging folder into editor
data.body: Atom crashes on windows 7 after dragging folder into editor

data.title: Move Bootstrap to a separate package
data.body:
⚠️  This is in parallel to #11839 + 11875. Don't merge all PRs, only pick one. ⚠️ 

This moves Bootstrap (and some core components) to a separate package. 

Refs: #6351, #8237 
### Stays in core `atom/atom/static`:
- [x] Octicons
- [x] Normalize
- [x] Scaffolding
- [x] Cursors
- [x] Panels
- [x] Panes
- [x] Syntax
- [x] `text-editor-light`
- [x] `workspace-view`
### Moved + merged into the [atom/ui](https://github.com/atom/ui) package:
- [x] Tooltips
- [x] Buttons + Button Groups
- [x] Lists
- [x] Code
- [x] Nav
- [x] Scaffolding
- [x] Utilities
- [x] Alerts
- [x] Tables
- [x] Forms
- [x] Type
- [x] Normalize
- [x] Clean up some un-used styles. Like IE hacks etc.
### Removed:
- 🔥  grid
- 🔥  input-groups
- 🔥  labels
- 🔥  thumbnails
- 🔥  close
## Motivation

Currently we load Bootstrap and then try to override it in core. Moving some of it into its own package allows more control and adjustments can be made directly. Also, making changes in a separate package feels less intimidating and can easier be rolled back in `package.json`.
## Concerns

What happens if you disable the UI package?

![ui](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/378023/15624689/ea3cc9c0-24c9-11e6-97cc-2e03d430279e.gif)

Because the main layout styles are still in core and themes override a lot of the components, it doesn't look too broken. Just a few things seem off or un-styled. For the tree-view or nav in the settings, we could remove the list styles in those packages to make a bit more robust. Being able to disable the UI package might inspire the community to create their own version or add additional components.

Some styles got removed, so there is a chance that something might look unstyled or off. Packages bundled with Atom should be fine, but it's hard to predict if community packages rely on any of the removed styles. Maybe in the Beta phase we can catch some regressions.

@atom/design @atom/core

data.title: HTML syntax highlighting breaking at non-word characters
data.body: I'm seeing this on all UI and syntax themes: Here's the current packages I'm using: - Running Atom 1.7.4 - Same thing occurred in safe mode

data.title: Regex's in a grammar don't work over multiple lines
data.body:
I'm making a syntax highlighter for Common Lisp, and one of the things I've noticed is that a regex will not work over multiple lines.  Example:

I'm using (effectively) this regex:

``` regex
(?<=\()
(def[\S]*)\s+
([\S]*)\s+
  (\(\s*
    ((
      [^()\s]+[\n\s]*|
      \([^()\s]+\s+[^()\s]+\)[\n\s]*
     )*)
  \))
```

and I get this:
![bad-img](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/500833/15619645/7e81feb8-2423-11e6-8a60-3b273c72bf95.png)

The `meh` & `hex` should also be red.  Using the built-in `oniguruma` in dev-mode gives me this:

![good-regex](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/500833/15619814/a10dc38a-2424-11e6-9a12-7445afb9d99d.png)

and even trying it out in something like `regex101.com` says this should work just fine.  Ao there must be something else that is going on...

The actual implementation is [located here](https://github.com/serialhex/language-common-lisp/blob/master/grammars/lisp.cson#L345-L355).

BTW, this effects the Racket highlighting also:
![racket](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/500833/15620061/00568e2a-2426-11e6-84db-3d2e58830274.png)

Thanks for any help!

data.title: Atom crashes opening file by command line, El Capitan
data.body:
1. The problem is not reproducible using safe mode. It works fine in safe mode. 
2. I am running the latest version, 1.7.4

I am opening some html files using the command line with the command 'atom .' After a few moments atom becomes unresponsive and then crashes. Here is a console trace during load time up to the crash. 

5/27/16 11:22:12.765 AM Atom[1441]: App load time: 265ms
5/27/16 11:22:14.959 AM launchservicesd[78]: SecTaskLoadEntitlements failed error=22
5/27/16 11:22:14.963 AM launchservicesd[78]: SecTaskLoadEntitlements failed error=22
5/27/16 11:22:14.979 AM launchservicesd[78]: SecTaskLoadEntitlements failed error=22
5/27/16 11:22:14.982 AM launchservicesd[78]: SecTaskLoadEntitlements failed error=22

There are no errors in the developer console in Atom, the application becomes unresponsive before anything is logged, I am assuming.

data.title: Failed to move entry .... already exists
data.body:
### Description

Unable to drag-n-drop overwrite a file.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Pick a file (in my case from the desktop).
2. Drag the file onto the folder structure of an open project.
3. You'll get the following error:

![selection_002](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7646510/15610038/41205740-23f1-11e6-9235-2873dd99dc9a.png)

**Expected behavior:** Either automatically overwrites or Atom prompts me to overwrite.

**Actual behavior:** Does nothing.
### Versions

Atom 1.7.3
